description: HONK!!!
Honk!
The University of York campus is full of ducks, including the world famous longboi.
James college is a college at the University of York.
Roses is the University's annual varsity competition vs Lancaster (ROSES ARE WHITE!)
Roses are white! Don't let anyone from Lancaster tell you otherwise.
York is famously a walled city, they surround the city and are 4.2km long!
The vikings invaded and captured york in 886AD, they named the city 'Jorvik'
The river Ouse runs through the center of York, and sometimes onto it's streets when it floods.
The city of York has four medival main gates that are linked bu the walls, Bootham, Micklegate, Monk, Walmgate.
York is supposedly one of the most haunted, spooooooooooooky.
Romans first settled in York in 73AD, and Constantine the Great was first proclaimed leader in the city.
The city of York regularly floods, leaving some students favourite drinking spots under water.
Terry's is a British chocolate and confectionery maker, formerly based in York,
Nouse is a student newspaper and news website at the University of York. It's the oldest society at the university!
If you've ever been into York on a Saturday morning, you're probably very familiar with York Roast Co's Yorkshire Pudding wraps!
The Yorkshire Dales are a lovely area to explore, and are only a short drive away from York.
You'll probably walk across Walmgate Stray at least once in your university career. It can get pretty chilly in Winter!
Sir Ronald Urwick Cooke was a Vice-Chancellor at the university. He even has a building named after him on East Campus, the Ron Cooke Hub!
Visit the Roger Kirk Centre, next to James College, for a bite to eat and a catch-up with your friends/
Clifford's Tower is one of York's most iconic attractions. The tower recently reopened after a conservation project, so make sure to visit and climb to the top!
22 Acres are the University of York's playing fields, nestled away next to Halifax College.
If you're ever in Derwent, make sure to pay The Courtyard a visit. With events from Karaoke to Quiz Nights, there's something for everyone!
The Glasshouse is Langwith's student bar, over on East Campus. Stop by for a drink and a game of pool!
Linking the two university campuses, Field Lane is a popular route for students commuting to and from lectures.
York Racecourse traditionally hosts the Summer Ball for University of York students every year. It's certainly an experience!
Horse racing is a tradition in York dating all the way back to Roman times!
Situated near the station, The Punch Bowl is one of the two Wetherspoons pubs in York, and is a great place to get cheap food and drink.
